net.proteusframework.core.metric

Class DeviceMetric

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.core.metric.DeviceMetric
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DpiDeviceMetric

    public abstract class DeviceMetric
extends Object
    A DeviceMetric instance is used to realize Metric objects. It does various conversions based on how the underlying device is handled. For example, a printer deals with physical dimensions such as paper size which can be specified in millimeters. A monitor uses pixels but can convert from millimeters using the DPI of the monitor.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public Dimension add(Dimension a,
            Dimension b)
        Adds two Dimension objects. Uses the add() methods to keep Metric classes consistent. Adds each component of the Dimension individually.
        Parameters:
        a - The first operand
        b - The second operand
        Returns:
        a+b

      • add

        public Metric add(Metric a,
         Metric b,
         boolean useWidth)
        Adds two metrics together. This method attempts to pick a good result Metric class using several critieria. If the Metric objects are of the same class, that class is used. Otherwise the native Metric is used as used by the result of the getNativeSize() method.
        Parameters:
        a - The first operand
        b - The second operand
        useWidth - true to use width conversion if needed, use height otherwise
        Returns:
        a+b

        public Metric addHeight(Metric a,
               Metric b)
        Adds two metrics together. This method attempts to pick a good result Metric class using several critieria. If the Metric objects are of the same class, that class is used. Otherwise the native Metric is used as used by the result of the getNativeSize() method.
        Parameters:
        a - The first operand
        b - The second operand
        Returns:
        a+b

      • addWidth

        public Metric addWidth(Metric a,
              Metric b)
        Adds two metrics together. This method attempts to pick a good result Metric class using several critieria. If the Metric objects are of the same class, that class is used. Otherwise the native Metric is used as used by the result of the getNativeSize() method.

      • getMilliSize

        public Dimension getMilliSize()
        Get the size of the device in millimeters. This method calls getNativeSize() and then milliMetric() for the width and height. A subclass should return the value of getNativeSize() if the underlying device uses millimeters as the native unit.
        Returns:
        The dimensions of the device in millimeters.

      • getNativeSize

        public abstract Dimension getNativeSize()
        Get the native dimensions of the device. The Metric objects will be in the native unit.
        Returns:
        The dimensions of the device

      • getPixelSize

        public Dimension getPixelSize()
        Get the size of the device in pixels. This method calls getNativeSize() and then pixelMetric() for the width and height. A subclass should return the value of getNativeSize() if the underlying device uses pixels as the native unit.
        Returns:
        The dimensions of the device in pixels.

      • getPointSize

        public Dimension getPointSize()
        Get the size of the device in points. This method calls getNativeSize() and then pointMetric() for the width and height. A subclass should return the value of getNativeSize() if the underlying device uses pixels as the native unit.
        Returns:
        The dimensions of the device in pixels.

      • isAbsolute

        public boolean isAbsolute(Dimension dim)
        Determines if the given Dimension is using absolute metrics.
        Parameters:
        dim - The Dimension to check
        Returns:
        true if an absolute dimension

        public boolean isAbsolute(Metric metric)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if an absolute metric

      • milliDimension

        public Dimension milliDimension(Dimension dim)
        Convert the given Dimension object to using MilliMetric objects. PercentMetric objects will be relative to the device size.
        Parameters:
        dim - The Dimension to convert
        Returns:
        The dimensions in the MilliMetric equivalent

      • milliMetricHeight

        public abstract MilliMetric milliMetricHeight(Metric metric)
        Convert the given Metric to a MilliMetric object. PercentMetric objects will be relative to the device size. The given metric is assumed to be a height.
        Parameters:
        metric - The Metric to convert
        Returns:
        The MilliMetric equivalent

      • milliMetricWidth

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The MilliMetric equivalent

        Returns:

      • substractHeight

        public Metric substractHeight(Metric a,
                     Metric b)
        Substracts metric b from a. This method attempts to pick a good result Metric class using several critieria. If the Metric objects are of the same class, that class is used. Otherwise the native Metric is used as used by the result of the getNativeSize() method.
        Parameters:
        a - The first operand
        b - The second operand
        Returns:
        a-b

      • substractWidth

        Returns:
